issues.description: The solution implementation of toString() uses the wrong return type: it declares public Object toString() with an @Override annotation. The problem statement and Java's Object.toString() expect a String return type. Declaring Object as the return type is not a valid override (Object is a supertype of String), so the method will not correctly override Object.toString(); with the @Override annotation present this will cause a compilation error. This contradicts the problem instructions to implement a custom toString() that returns a String and would confuse students or make the solution code uncompilable.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the toString() method signature in the solution (and ensure template guidance expects the same) to public String toString() and return the formatted String. Keep the @Override annotation. Example: @Override public String toString() { return "Lecture{...}"; } This will align the solution with the problem statement and produce a valid override that compiles.
